channel.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - Regions - Middle East
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

image.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - Regions - Middle East

channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2016 Turner Broadcasting System, Inc. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: Thousands of civilians still awaiting evacuation from Aleppo
Did Russia's playbook transform the war?
item.description: Russia is using the same tactics in Syria as in Chechnya -- turn all your enemies into "terrorists."

item.title: Orphans: Please get us out of Aleppo
item.description: Children at an orphanage in eastern Aleppo send heartbreaking plea to the world.

item.title: Five years to ruins
item.description: In 2012, Aleppo was well into its fourth millennium. It was Syria's economic hub, its most populous city and a tourist attraction drawing thousands of visitors to its UNESCO World Heritage sites, including a 12th century mosque and 13th century citadel.

item.title: EgyptAir: Traces of explosives found
Right to Protect? Empty words after Aleppo
item.description: The world has watched in real time as the hell of the Syrian civil war has caught families in its grip and refused to let go.

item.title: Assad: Trump can be 'natural ally'
item.description: Donald Trump will become a "natural ally" of Syria if he holds fast to a hard line on terrorists.

item.title: UN envoy blasts Assad regime
item.description: The US ambassador to the UN unleashed a scathing attack on the Syrian government on Tuesday.

item.title: Tunisia: Pregnant 13-year-old can marry
item.description: A Tunisian court Tuesday has approved the marriage of a 13-year-old girl to a 20-year-old relative who made her pregnant, a move that caused an uproar among organizations concerned with chidren's rights in the country.

item.title: Qatar's labor laws 'fail to prevent exploitation'
item.description: Amnesty International claims Qatar's new laws do not improve the rights of migrant workers, who are key to the building of 12 stadiums for the 2022 World Cup.

item.title: Israel awaits arrival of first F-35 jets
item.description: Two of the fifty F-35 stealth fighter jets that Israel ordered from the US are scheduled to arrive on Monday.

item.title: Analysis: Assad has won a battle, but not the war
item.description: The Syrian regime's capture of eastern Aleppo changes the face of the country's horrendous civil war; the fortunes of the many rebel groups arrayed against it have rarely seemed so bleak. But few observers expect them to sue for peace or lay down their arms.

item.title: Sweeping ISIS from Mosul house by house
item.description: Wrapped in a blanket and wearing pink sandals, a little girl sobs in fear as she walks down the street, gunfire blasting at the end of the road.

item.title: US Defense Sec visits Iraq
item.description: Defense Secretary Ash Carter made an unannounced visit to Iraq on Sunday, where he will get an update on the push to seize the city of Mosul from ISIS, Pentagon press secretary Peter Cook said in a statement.

item.title: Egypt toughens penalties for FGM
item.description: Egypt has brought into effect an amended law that toughens penalties on those who perform female genital mutilation, a practice that reportedly affects over 90% of Egyptian women, the health ministry announced.

item.title: The voices of Iraq's minorities
Messi meets Afghan 'plastic shirt' boy
The universal language of sacred geometry
item.description: As Venus orbits the Earth it traces the shape of a five-pointed star. Slice a cucumber, and you will see perfect triangles within.

item.title: The Dead Sea is drying out
Can architecture save Syria?
item.description: Marwa al-Sabouni's new book, "The Battle for Home: The Vision of a Young Architect in Syria" looks at how how architecture can heal the city on Homs.

item.title: Visit CNN Arabic
What makes the Arab world laugh?
item.description: Manal Awad and Fadi Al Shehri are two stand-up comedians who are laughing through conflict. CNN meet up with them at the Yas Mall Arab Comedy Festival.

item.title: What are Russia's objectives in Syria?
item.description: CNN's Matthew Chance explains why Russia wants to maintain its strong presence in the Middle Eastern country.

item.title: DiCaprio as a Persian poet? Sure, says Maz Jobrani
item.description: The Iranian-American comedian calls for more diversity in Hollywood -- something he's also written about in "I'm Not a Terrorist, But I've Played One On TV."

item.title: UK chose war 'before diplomacy' was exhausted
item.description: CNN's Becky Anderson dissects the findings of the Chilcot report with former U.S. Central Command adviser Ali Khedery and journalist Faisal Al Yafai.

item.title: Aspiring star killed by ISIS
item.description: Iraq is mourning the death of "Adel Euro" who was killed in a Baghdad suicide blast on Sunday. At least 250 people lost their lives in the same attack.

item.title: Arabs can't stop talking about this TV show
item.description: From terrorism to sectarian divides, "Seflie" is the most-watched television program in Saudi Arabia and tackles tough issues facing the Middle East.

item.title: Car bomb attacks hit shopping districts in Baghdad
item.description: Twin car bombings in the Iraqi capital of Baghdad have killed more than 120 people. CNN's Ben Wedeman reports.

item.title: Iran: We don't have 'a fight to pick with Saudi Arabia'
item.description: Foreign Minister Javad Zarif tells Christiane Amanpour that while Saudi Arabia is "panicking," the two countries can coexist in the region.

item.title: The 2016 Epic Architecture Quiz
